rules: Rule1: If the project receives grant funding, then the project is successful
Rule2: If the artwork collection digitization is delayed, then the artwork collection digitization is completed
Rule3: If the museum obtains all necessary permissions, then the digital archive does not violate copyright
Rule4: If the digital archive passes quality check, then should the project meeting its deadline not result in project success, the project does not receive an extension
Rule5: If the digital archive launches publicly, then when the digital archive does not pass quality check, the digital archive fails public release
Rule6: If the digital archive launches privately, then under the condition that the digital archive does not pass quality check, the digital archive fails public release
Rule7: If the project receives private donor funding, then the project is successful
Rule8: The project receives an award or the project is successful
Rule9: If the digital archive has technical issues, then the project does not receive an award
Rule10: If critics praise the digital archive, then given that the digital archive meets accessibility standards, should the project receive an award, the project gains recognition
Rule11: Critics praise the digital archive or the public praises the digital archive

Rule12: If the public praises the digital archive, then under the condition that the digital archive meets accessibility standards, whenever the project receives an award, the project gains recognition
Rule13: If the board approves the project, then the project receives grant funding
Rule14: The board approves the project or the director approves the project
Rule15: If the director approves the project, then the project receives private donor funding
Rule16: Should the project meeting its deadline not lead to project success, then the project receives an extension
Rule17: When the digital archive neither launches publicly nor launches privately, then the digital archive release is canceled
Rule18: Provided that the digital archive does not launch publicly and does not launch privately, the digital archive release is not canceled
Rule19: Under the condition that the digital archive requiring format conversion does not lead to it using legacy format, the museum uses its internal team
Rule20: Should the digital archive requiring format conversion not result in it using legacy format, then the museum does not hire a technology consultant firm
Rule21: If the museum using its internal team does not lead to hiring a technology consultant firm, then the artwork collection digitization is delayed
Rule22: Provided that the museum using its internal team does not cause hiring a technology consultant firm, the artwork collection digitization is not completed
Rule23: If the museum does not obtain all necessary permissions, then the museum faces a lawsuit
Rule24: If the project is not successful, then the digital archive violates copyright
Rule25: Under the condition that the project is not successful, the digital archive requires format conversion
Rule26: If the project is not successful, then the digital archive does not use legacy format
facts: Fact1: The project meets its deadline
Fact2: The digital archive has technical issues
Fact3: The digital archive meets accessibility standards
Fact4: The museum does not face a lawsuit
Fact5: The digital archive does not fail public release
Fact6: The project does not gain recognition
